description:
The 3rd season of PriPara.

One day, a huge UFO appeared in the sky above the town of Parajuku, and glittering jewels sprinkled down from the sky. Now it's been decided that the Idol God Grand Prix will take place at Parajuku’s PriPara and the PriPara system has been updated. Around this time, Laala meets a mysterious baby that fell from the sky. This baby calls Laala ‘Mama’ and refuses to leave her side, so Laala ends up taking care of the child, but what will happen now?!

(Source: Honey's Anime)

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)

__[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/saito/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斉藤恒芳)__

__Tsuneyoshi Saito__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He has composed for several anime series, films, and TV dramas.

[Official Website](https://iris.dive2ent.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/iris-official-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iris_official_) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/iris.dive2.official) | [Ustream](http://www.ustream.tv/user/dive2iRis)

i☆Ris is an idol group formed by Avex in 2012 under the DIVE II Entertainment label. Its members are also seiyuu.

__Members:__
• [Saki Yamakita](https://anilist.co/staff/117183/Saki-Yamakita) (山北早紀) - Color: Green; (leader)
• [Yuu Serizawa](https://anilist.co/staff/116515/Yuu-Serizawa) (芹澤優) -  Color: Blue
• [Himika Akaneya](https://anilist.co/staff/119203/Himika-Akaneya) (茜屋日海夏) - Color: Purple
• [Yuki Wakai](https://anilist.co/staff/122697/Yuki-Wakai) (若井友希) - Color: Red
• [Miyu Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/119204/Miyu-Kubota) (久保田未夢) - Color: Orange
• [Azuki Shibuya](https://anilist.co/staff/126076/Azuki-Shibuya) (澁谷梓希) - Color: Yellow (announced to graduate on March 31st, 2021.)

__Height:__ 161 cm (5'3")

 [Twitter](https://twitter.com/iRis_a_himi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/himika_akaneya_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwCfG7UHT9jubtG1M5dH4Bw) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=149) | [Profile (i☆Ris)](https://iris.dive2ent.com/profile/member.php?id=1000227)


A Japanese voice actress and singer. She's currently a member of the idol group [i☆Ris](https://anilist.co/staff/131442).

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/dcms_plusdb/index.php/item?cell003=%E3%81%9F%E8%A1%8C&cell029=%E5%A5%B3%E6%80%A7&keyword=&cell028=&cell004=&name=%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%B5%B7&id=242&label=1) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minazou_373) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minazou_in_sta/)

Announced her marriage on November 22, 2023.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Alice](https://anilist.co/character/292758/Tendou-Alice) - Blue Archive (Video Game)
- Linaria - Granblue Fantasy (Video Game)
- Urakaze, Wakaba - Azur Lane (Video Game)
- Rover (Female) - Wuthering Waves (Video Game)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/56090532)

Originally an animator. Often works with [Makoto Moriwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109581/).
